metadata.synopsis: Minsc's default dialogue. In the current entries, he reflects on his opinion of us and our adventures so far, as well as revealing a little of history.

0.speaker: Minsc
0.text: Make sure you are refreshed before we set out again, friend. The road to justice is paved with kicked buttocks.
0.context: NodeContext: Various pleasant greetings, exclusive to camp

29.speaker: Minsc
29.context: NodeContext: Flat, not interested in talking to us. We've brough his approval quite low.

30.speaker: Minsc
30.text: Another Bhaalspawn, buried by our hand. Bhaal should learn better than to send his offspring against us - they might as well be babes, dropped bare-bottom into the Rashemen winter.

66.speaker: Minsc
66.text: Do you feel it, Boo? The path of virtue beneath my boots once more! Boo and I - we are in your debt, my friend.
66.context: NodeContext: Begins eyes closed, just taking it in. Looks at player when addressing them.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: How was your reunion with Viconia?

128.speaker: Minsc
128.text: Boo is overjoyed with our victory. Another den of evil vanquished, and an old foe defeated!

118.speaker: Minsc
118.text: Well, Viconia was a friend for a short time beforehand. But then a foe once more!

345.speaker: Minsc
345.text: Yes, Boo - a most wicked witch!
345.context: NodeContext: Responding to Boo's squeak of disapproval about Viconia

172.speaker: Minsc
172.text: The very mention of her name gives him nightmares to this day.
172.context: NodeContext: Hushed aside - Boo is senstive about this,, it's a touchy topic

123.speaker: Player
123.text: What did she do to him?

247.speaker: Minsc
247.text: Boo and Minsc have travelled far and wide, and met many fine and not-so-fine people.

272.speaker: Minsc
272.text: It will surprise you to learn that even the wisest of friends do not always recognise Boo for what he is.

364.speaker: Minsc
364.text: The drow was a cruel witch, but a clever one.

365.speaker: Minsc
365.text: She knew what Boo was right away, and she had never seen his like before! She wished to inspect his handsome magnificence!

144.speaker: Minsc
144.text: And so she did! One night, while he lay asleep, twitching his whiskers in happy dreams, she crept upon his tiny bedroll holding a knife as slim as a toothpick.

83.speaker: Minsc
83.text: She meant to spill his miniature guts and study them!

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I don't blame her - he is a scientific wonder.

253.speaker: Minsc
253.text: That is true, but he is also a living thing and has need of all his inner-parts.

90.speaker: Minsc
90.text: Thankfully, he preserved his guts heroically.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I'm surprised you didn't kill her there and then.

255.speaker: Minsc
255.text: I did not get the chance!

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Thank the gods you stopped her.

186.speaker: Minsc
186.text: Ha! Minsc did not stop her - he did not need to.

214.speaker: Minsc
214.text: Boo never sleeps deeply while evil is near. He sprang into action, and almost blinded the witch!

347.speaker: Minsc
347.text: She had fled from our camp by morning, when Boo told me the whole tale over a breakfast of berries and nuts.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Why is he so scared of Viconia?

2.speaker: Minsc
2.text: Do not be afraid, Boo! She is not here.
2.context: NodeContext: Boo squeaks in alarm before the line

101.speaker: Minsc
101.text: And you! Bite your tongue until your eyes water and your hairs curl!

329.speaker: Minsc
329.text: Boo! Do not listen! Our friend has lost their mind!
329.context: CinematicNodeContext: puts his fingers in his ears to block out the noiseNodeContext: Boo squeaks in alarm at the start. Minsc puts fingers into his ears. As if blocking out words from his mind.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Sorry - but why is he so afraid of her?

273.speaker: Minsc
273.text: Good. Boo will tell you when it is good that you talk again.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: She's gone now, Boo. You don't need to be afraid.

107.speaker: Minsc
107.text: Those words are more soothing than the salve Minsc applies to the places the armour chafes. You are a kind and gentle soul.
107.context: NodeContext: Boo squeaks in relief before the line

17.speaker: Minsc
17.text: You hear what our friend says, Boo? Viconia is gone for good this time!

303.speaker: Minsc
303.text: Argh! I am sorry, Boo. I will stop up my clumsy mouth and would tear out my hair if any remained!
303.context: NodeContext: Boo squeak before Minsc's line

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Why is Boo so afraid of her?

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Hard to believe Shadowheart grew up in that place.

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Do you remember why you were meeting with the Zhentarim?

284.speaker: Minsc
284.text: So dark an alliance sealed with Zhentish contracts, cultish vows, and a dragon's shining hoard! You think Minsc could forget?

63.speaker: Minsc
63.text: You are correct. I have no idea what any of that was about. But we shall simply - GAH!
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc jerks in pain at end of line and goes fishing beneath his armour out of frame. Brings Boo out in cupped hands [same anim as recruitment]NodeContext: Minsc jerks in pain at end of line and goes fishing beneath his armour out of frame. Brings Boo out in cupped hands [same anim as recruitment]

335.speaker: Minsc
335.text: Boo - why do you gnaw at my soft parts? I am trying to -

134.speaker: Minsc
134.text: This truth you seek. Boo believes that Minsc is knowing more than Minsc knows. But - it is a difficult thing.

299.speaker: Minsc
299.text: There are memories of this time that Minsc does not remember. And Boo suggests that, just as he helps with tricksome itches in awkward places...
299.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Sighing - returning Boo to armour.
[Same anim as recruitment - but close shot of Minsc so actual shoulder contact is out of frame, in case of armour changes.]NodeContext: [Re-take request.] Sighing, working himself up to agree to something he doesn't want to - allowing us to use the tadpole.

175.speaker: Minsc
175.text: You must reach what Minsc cannot. The parasite - you can use it to tickle free whatever truth you seek.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Or I could just crack you over the head, see what shakes loose?

103.speaker: Minsc
103.context: NodeContext: Minsc takes a big deep breath to enthusiastically agree, but is cut off by a sharp squeak from Boo.

232.speaker: Minsc
232.text: I much prefer your methods, my friend, but Boo is resolute. The worm it must be.

332.speaker: Minsc
332.text: The worm has already whipped me around the city like a slack-backed pony. I have no wish to saddle myself a second time. But...

85.speaker: Minsc
85.text: If it cannot be Boo who pops inside my skull for a rummage, then I trust you.

356.speaker: Minsc
356.text: Or Jaheira - but she is currently possessed of an empty head.

116.speaker: Jaheira
116.text: I count my blessings every day.

193.speaker: Narrator
193.text: *At first, there is nothing. His mind is empty as a still expanse of open country. But then:*

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *Your face - the Stone Lord's face - mirrored in bloodied steel. In the heat of burning buildings, you hold your blade high above pale, frightened faces.*

119.speaker: Minsc
119.text: No. That is not right. I slew only monsters. The voice said that they were monsters.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *A whisper. The Absolute's voice, twisting the petty Guild thieves before you into snarling, savage beasts - feeding on the weak of your city.*

104.speaker: Minsc
104.text: The Guild. The Stone Lord hunted them. Peeled away their rotten ranks one by one, to lay bare their corrupt heart:

371.speaker: Minsc
371.text: Nine-Fingers Keene. That is what the Absolute bought black Zhentish steel to do - to kill the guildmaster!

42.speaker: Player
42.text: From what I saw, you took great pleasure in your work.

203.speaker: Minsc
203.text: That was not Minsc. That was the Stone Lord.

140.speaker: Minsc
140.text: Whatever strangeness you believe you saw, there is only one simple truth in Minsc's mind: the cult is evil. The Guild is evil. And Minsc. Fights. Evil.

152.speaker: Minsc
152.text: If you cannot believe his words, then watch his doings! We will foil the Zhentish plot - and then we will show Nine-Fingers the five-fingers of Minsc! Yes?

342.speaker: Player
342.text: So the Zhentarim overthrow the Guild. What then? What do the cult get?

37.speaker: Minsc
37.text: What does it matter? Cultish thinking has occupied Minsc's mind for long enough - now it is time for doing.

223.speaker: Minsc
223.text: And this talk of evil overthrowing evil - pah! Like a many-headed hydra biting at its own throat.

10.speaker: Minsc
10.text: Bring forth the hydra, says Boo - more faces for the punching! First we pop the Zhentarim plot, then we show Nine-Fingers the five-fingers of Minsc. Yes?

156.speaker: Minsc
156.text: No, Jaheira! The Zhent, the Guild - two cheeks of the same evil end. Minsc will punt them from the city, and with them all memory of this Stone Lord.

287.speaker: Minsc
287.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down to an uncertain squeak from Boo.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Nine-Fingers did put a bounty on your head...

68.speaker: Minsc
68.text: It is only justice, then, that we put a boot upon hers.

301.speaker: Jaheira
301.text: First, let us just get to the Guildhall. We can puff out our chests and figure out what to do once we are there.
301.context: NodeContext: Sighing, needs to urgently move on - we're not doing to talk Minsc down here.

319.speaker: Player
319.text: You seem keen to forget that this was all your doing.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: You're doing it again - charging in without listening. Did you forget what Jaheira told you?

174.speaker: Minsc
174.text: Minsc has forgotten nothing. Once we are done with the undoing of his deeds, then we will speak of this Stone Lord.

321.speaker: Player
321.text: We had better get to the Guildhall before the battle is done.

211.speaker: Minsc
211.text: Until Minsc arrives, the battle is not even begun.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: There's no need for that. We'll find another way.

352.speaker: Minsc
352.text: I do not often go against the advisings of my hamster, but... as you wish.

159.speaker: Minsc
159.text: Perhaps you might speak to the corpses you left behind. I'm sure Boo can scare a soul back into it long enough to answer some questions.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: You're quite quick to call me 'friend'.

277.speaker: Minsc
277.text: Of course, my friend! Or - are we not friends?
277.context: NodeContext: Last line a little aghast, as if it hadn't occured to him.

317.speaker: Player
317.text: There hasn't been much time to look for friendship in all of this.

304.speaker: Minsc
304.text: Boo never looks to give me fleas. Sometimes, you just pick these things up along the path.

67.speaker: Minsc
67.text: Does it? You have seen all there is to see of Minsc, short of stripping me down to my stitches. Perhaps I can -

206.speaker: Minsc
206.text: But no, Boo has only just made himself comfortable. Let us leave the inspection for camp.

86.speaker: Minsc
86.text: Then you have a sword at your side and a hamster at hand, whenever you need them.

33.speaker: Minsc
33.text: Unless I die. Or you die. Or you do anything at all to upset Boo.

53.speaker: Minsc
53.text: Now - does Boo see a question in your eye, or just the parasite poking through?

350.speaker: Player
350.text: Answer me honestly. What's with the hamster?

340.speaker: Player
340.text: No question, just a warning - turn on me again, and I won't save you a second time.

192.speaker: Minsc
192.text: My friend, I promise you this - you have nothing to fear from Minsc.

320.speaker: Minsc
320.text: Should any of us show the slightest sign of weakening to the worm, Boo will slaughter us all in our beds.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: The only thing we have in common is the worm.

57.speaker: Minsc
57.text: Ohoho! This iciness, it will not withstand the forging fires of friendship. You will see!

372.speaker: Player
372.text: I'd like to know a little more about you.

240.speaker: Player
240.text: When our minds mingled, I saw some... strange things.

91.speaker: Minsc
91.text: Oh? The mind of Minsc is a simple place. Of what strangeness do you speak?

361.speaker: Narrator
361.text: *The memories resurface, a lifetime of battles blurring into one. The single constant is Minsc, launching into the fray no matter the foe - be they god, monster, or man.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *It seems just the barest glimpse of what the man before you has seen and done: but enough to know that he has no right to still be alive.*

35.speaker: Minsc
35.text: Ah, wait! That look in your eye - I know exactly what visions of Minsc you have seen, to cause you such wonder:

61.speaker: Minsc
61.text: Thrice-laced, in the Rashemaar style, so that a berserker might split skulls without fear of splitting britches, too.

199.speaker: Minsc
199.text: They are fiendishly complex, but fear not for Minsc. With training, he has learned to master the many little knots.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Never mind your pants. You've walked between planes, fought gods.

70.speaker: Minsc
70.text: Well... as have you, no? Do not forget that when you gaze into Minsc, Minsc also gazes into you.

325.speaker: Minsc
325.text: We both fight evil, wherever it is found. The who and where are less important than the hamsters you meet along the way.

300.speaker: Player
300.text: Right. Funny how they never made space for any of that in the songs.

160.speaker: Minsc
160.text: The bards, says Boo. They conspire not to safeguard our trousers, but to rid the world of pants entire.

326.speaker: Minsc
326.text: So still that wandering eye, my friend. You have met your match in the tailors of Rashemen.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: You are literally too dumb to be breathing.

309.speaker: Minsc
309.text: Hah! So thought my first teacher in the berserker arts. I gulped air like a greedy ox, so she set me pulling her cart until I learned better.

168.speaker: Minsc
168.text: Eventually Minsc got so mad he threw her cart down the mountain-side - my first berserker rage. A fine teacher.

167.speaker: Minsc
167.text: On this matter of sharing memories, I see no reason for us to worry at one another's worms.

62.speaker: Minsc
62.text: If there is more we wish to know, we can simply... ask, no?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm sorry. I didn't realise you were uncomfortable with our new power.

270.speaker: Minsc
270.text: Is it power? True, it has made Minsc strong - Boo can scarcely get comfortable, so firm has my physique grown.

71.speaker: Minsc
71.text: But what does the parasite take in return? It is a horror, wrapped in honey - stay your sweet tooth, says Boo.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: Of course. A warrior speaks their mind, instead of reading others.

257.speaker: Minsc
257.text: Exactly so! If I must peer into the mind of my enemy, I use an axe. For friends, there is ale.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: Don't shy away from the tadpole. It's a useful way to know someone's true thoughts.

26.speaker: Minsc
26.text: True thoughts, meaning there are... untrue thoughts? As if someone would think one thing, but say another?

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Demonstrate. Reach out for his mind.

283.speaker: Narrator
283.text: *Your minds weave into one, what you seek laid instantly bare - his single innermost thought, at the very centre of his mind:*

13.speaker: Minsc
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc blankly responding via mind-meld.

297.speaker: Minsc
297.text: No, my friend. If you fear you have a question that Minsc cannot answer, then you can simply ask Boo.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: We ought to discuss the tadpole.

202.speaker: Minsc
202.text: As you wish - but quietly. It. Is. Listening.
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stage whisper, as if he can speak at a volume that deceives the parasite.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: You mentioned the Emperor appeared as someone you lost. It's just trying to gain your trust.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: We need its power. The Emperor can help us control it, if we're careful.

41.speaker: Minsc
41.text: There is a very ancient and very wise saying that Minsc lives by.

239.speaker: Minsc
239.text: He who would try to control evil must beware lest evil tricks him, steals his clothes, and kicks his backside with his own boots.

46.speaker: Minsc
46.text: I read it on the privy wall in the Blushing Mermaid many years ago.

315.speaker: Player
315.text: You don't understand. The Emperor is the only reason we were able to save you.

367.speaker: Minsc
367.text: Oh, Minsc knows all about this Emperor. It has tried to introduce itself to me already.

38.speaker: Minsc
38.text: I do not think our new friend wishes to see me blubbering, Boo.

362.speaker: Minsc
362.text: Minsc is normally the strong and violent type, but if you insist on hearing a sad tale, he can tell it.

189.speaker: Minsc
189.text: This Emperor played a very cruel trick - it made me believe that something lost had been found.

313.speaker: Minsc
313.text: It came to me in dreams, wearing a face I never thought to see again.
313.context: NodeContext: Entire story told with tone of fond remembrance. Still Minsc, but a slightly softer, more reflective version - he is fiercely proud when he remembers Dyanaheir

355.speaker: Minsc
355.text: Dynaheir. A witch of my homeland. She was to be the greatest of them, and I her protector.

296.speaker: Minsc
296.text: It was not easy. She was a fierce and independent cub - she did not think she needed mother-bear Minsc to protect her!

196.speaker: Minsc
196.text: And she was right. The elders sent us out into the world, thinking it would teach her to bow a little.

197.speaker: Minsc
197.text: But it was the world that bowed to Dynaheir, wherever she went, and Minsc blundered along behind.

6.speaker: Minsc
6.text: And in the end, it was she who died - protecting me.
6.context: NodeContext: Quiet, but more bittersweet than grieving. It is what it is -he's made his peace

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Did the Emperor make you relive her death?

343.speaker: Minsc
343.text: No, my friend. It is not the past I saw. But Dynaheir as she would have been. Should have been.

187.speaker: Minsc
187.text: That... is in the past. It showed me Dynaheir not as she was, but as she would have been. Should have been.

84.speaker: Minsc
84.text: Hearing her voice again, for a moment Minsc almost believed it. But then the Emperor made a mistake - it did the one thing that Dynaheir would never, ever do.
84.context: NodeContext: Rueful at how he was almost fooled - then amusement at how wrong the Emperor got it

359.speaker: Minsc
359.text: It told Minsc exactly what he wanted to hear.
359.context: NodeContext: Requesting slight re-take of this line with more warmth. He's remembering how the Emperor's attempted manipulations are exactly the opposite of the true Dynaheir's blunt and direct manner.

228.speaker: Minsc
228.text: Dynaheir, hers was more the habit of teaching Minsc many new ways to say the word 'fool'.

237.speaker: Minsc
237.text: Bah, I think on what she would say to Minsc now, cowering from a creature in his own skull. Fine! If you say this tadpole is a weapon, then let us wield it.
237.context: NodeContext: Abrupt, snapping himself out of it. Grudgingly realising that Dynaheir would stop at nothing to end the Absolute, and so he can do no less

157.speaker: Minsc
157.text: So long as it is still our hearts that guide us, yes? Or better yet, my hamster.
157.context: NodeContext: Not a warning, more a firm condition he sets down for himself and us in using the tadpole -  we do not let ourselves be used by it in turn.

217.speaker: Minsc
217.text: Minsc has made many mistakes, but he has learned from every one of them.

95.speaker: Minsc
95.text: The lesson is always the same - carry a bigger sword!

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Boo is smart - sharing your emotions is a good thing.

353.speaker: Player
353.text: Maybe not. Let's talk about something else.

288.speaker: Minsc
288.text: Minsc feels no shame in sorrow, mind. It is as much a part of life as breathing, or picking goblin teeth from your knuckles.

370.speaker: Minsc
370.text: It is simply that, the last time Minsc heaved great manly tears, Boo caught a nasty chill from the drowning.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: Then let's talk about something else.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: You're right. We should be wary of all mind flayers - Emperor included.

208.speaker: Minsc
208.text: You'll hear no argument from Boo!

338.speaker: Minsc
338.text: Or from Minsc. That mind-tickler has already caused me a great upset.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: We stand no chance if we don't use the tadpole's powers.

201.speaker: Minsc
201.text: Shhht, friend. Boo does not like worms. They make his butt go itchy and take his mind from butt-kicking. We do not need these tadpoles...

65.speaker: Minsc
65.text: You should stop listening to this Emperor. Minsc trusts it less than a Thayan Red Wizard.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: Do you know of a cure?

5.speaker: Minsc
5.text: On this matter, I have held small council with Boo. If the worm is lodged within our skulls, should it be not be possible to simply -

18.speaker: Minsc
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grits teeth and hunches over, growing red as he strainsNodeContext: Hunches over and straining while clutching his fists. His face growing red.

312.speaker: Minsc
312.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Strains all the harder, and stops at a sudden, soft sound.NodeContext: Strains all the harder, and stops at a sudden soft noise. 
Use: Boo_PigLikeSqueaks_Inquisitive_01

184.speaker: Minsc
184.text: Ah... pay that noise no mind. Boo has not feasted on evil's flesh in some time, and it has set his gut to bubbling.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: So you have no ideas for a cure?

77.speaker: Minsc
77.text: None at all. Though, Boo is tiny. Perhaps he could just crawl into our ears, and -
77.context:
NodeContext: Cuts off as Boo squeaks in objection to the idea:
Boo_Talketive_SqueakyHighPitch_19

244.speaker: Minsc
244.text: Ah. You are right, Boo. A ridiculous notion. It would be far too dark to see.
244.context:
NodeContext: Nodding as Boo objects to the idea of being forced to crawl into our skulls and fish out the tadpole. Perhaps not getting the reason for Boo's objection entirely right.
Boo responds at the end: Boo_PigLikeSqueaks_Inquisitive_04

32.speaker: Player
32.text: The parasite is evil - but with the Emperor's help, we can control its power.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: The Emperor has a way for us to become stronger. The Astral-Touched Tadpole.

169.speaker: Minsc
169.text: More talk of tadpoles? The one of flesh and fish is not enough?

161.speaker: Minsc
161.text: This... Astral tadpole looks a mite overripe, says Boo. By the measure of aeons.

349.speaker: Player
349.text: Trust me. This could make all the difference in defeating the cult.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: Trust me. This could make all the difference in defeating the cult.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: This could make all the difference in defeating the cult. Trust me, Minsc.

298.speaker: Minsc
298.text: Bah. Fine! Minsc will dine on the little rock-worm, if that is what you truly wish.

220.speaker: Minsc
220.text: It is not a matter of Minsc trusting you. It is his stomach that might prove treacherous. But...

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: I suppose it has not caused you to paint the air with your innards of late.

302.speaker: Minsc
302.text: Minsc does trust you. It is his stomach that might prove treacherous. But...

328.speaker: Minsc
328.context: NodeContext: A little terse, not at all convinced

368.speaker: Minsc
368.text: It is not a matter of trusting you. It is... more a matter of trusting Minsc's stomach. But his steel and strength are still yours to command.

154.speaker: Minsc
154.text: Minsc does trust you. It is only his stomach he doubts. But his strength and steel - these are still yours to command, my friend.

182.speaker: Minsc
182.text: Now let us speak of something else.

171.speaker: Minsc
171.text: ...Minsc will save his appetite for evil, I think.
171.context: NodeContext: Politely rebuffing the player's efforts to get him to consume an astral tadpole.

198.speaker: Minsc
198.text: More talk of tadpoles? Minsc crunched on the one of flesh and fish - was this not enough?

52.speaker: Minsc
52.text: Minsc shall be your shadow, as Boo is his.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: I don't need you right now. I'll meet you back at camp.

148.speaker: Minsc
148.text: As you wish! Eh... Boo? Do you know the way back...?
148.context: NodeContext: You've been dismissed but give a little look around - you don't know where camp is from here. You could be in a dangerous zone we can't camp in, a prison, or a literal dimension of hell. Either way, you're unfazed - just a little turned about.

59.speaker: Minsc
59.text: I fear we cannot find our way to camp from here, friend. But we shall be so quiet, you will not even know we are here. Argh.
59.context: NodeContext: Shrug - nothing you can do about it. 'Argh' is a loud and obnoxious yawn, immediately after promising to be quiet.

11.speaker: Minsc
11.text: Truly? But... you have seen my hamster, yes?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Actually, never mind. Stay with me.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Go on. I'll meet up with you later.

305.speaker: Minsc
305.text: Here we stay, then. But if Boo grows restless and chews holes in all your delicates, you have only yourself to blame.

200.speaker: Minsc
200.text: To camp, then. But if Boo grows restless and chews holes in all your delicates, you have only yourself to blame.

94.speaker: Minsc
94.text: That would take the heart from even my hamster.
94.context: NodeContext: After seeing something bad / sad: 'that was horrible'

137.speaker: Minsc
137.text: A fine deed we have done, to rid Faerûn of this man - all helm-hair and the haughtiness.

207.speaker: Minsc
207.text: Ohhh, this was the Lord Gortash we were sworn to do battle with, Boo?
207.context: NodeContext: Reacting to Boo informing you the annoying man you just killed also happened to be one of the main villains in the game. Pleased grunt of surprise.

149.speaker: Minsc
149.context: NodeContext: Flat, annoyed, we've brought his approval a little low

150.speaker: Minsc
150.text: Hello, friend. But forgive me - my hamster has his heart set on speaking to the other one.
150.context: NodeContext: Friendly, speaking to a travelling companion - but not the boss / main player, so not entering into a full conversation.

351.speaker: Minsc
351.text: Minsc and Boo surely would, but you have so many followers already that Boo cannot pick your scent from the pack.

146.speaker: Minsc
146.text: Boo likes all of our party well enough - but return when there are not so many of you.

260.speaker: Minsc
260.text: A little butt-kicking before breakfast. No better way to start the day!

262.speaker: Minsc
262.text: A moment, my friend. Minsc needs to think.

267.speaker: Minsc
267.text: My friend. Now we have settled the matter of the Guild, I fear there is something I must tell you. You and Boo both.

360.speaker: Minsc
360.text: It may shock you both to know, but Minsc and this Stone Lord: they are one man. The same one man.

15.speaker: Minsc
15.text: And that same one man... is Minsc.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I'm aware. You tried to kill me, multiple times.

127.speaker: Minsc
127.text: Never has Boo been more proud of my failures.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: Alas! Alack! It cannot be so!

60.speaker: Minsc
60.text: Please, my friend. Your noble tears will not make the confessing any easier.

263.speaker: Minsc
263.text: I wished to believe the Stone Lord's evil was the worm alone, a-tainting my thoughts with foul dung. But I see now - the dung was within Minsc all along.

100.speaker: Minsc
100.text: So I wonder. If Minsc can be a villain, and the Zhentarim now stand as the city's protectors - must it be so with all creatures? Is there good and evil within us all?

282.speaker: Minsc
282.text: So I wonder. If Minsc can be a villain, and Nine-Fingers call herself a hero: must it be so with all creatures? Is there good and evil within us all?

79.speaker: Minsc
79.text: So I wonder. If Minsc can be a villain, and Nine-Fingers a hero: must it be so with all creatures? Is there good and evil within us all?

221.speaker: Minsc
221.text: Heh. Boo calls this nonsense. Less thinking of bad thoughts, says he, and more breaking of bad bones.
221.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reacting to an indignant Boo squeak.NodeContext: Reacting to an indignant Boo squeak.

9.speaker: Minsc
9.text: But still - I would hear what you have to say on the matter, my friend.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: You believed you were following Jaheira - that's not evil.

354.speaker: Minsc
354.text: Even though it led to evil ends? And even the true Jaheira is not always right.

334.speaker: Minsc
334.text: She sometimes pets Boo a little too roughly. Or denies him the breakfast broth, so that I must dip him in the pot when she looks the other way.

89.speaker: Jaheira
89.text: I do not pet him too - wait. You do what?
89.context: NodeContext: Mid-objection before she realises the other half of what Minsc just said.

183.speaker: Minsc
183.text: I begin to wonder if good and evil is not a thing of knowing. If it is sometimes a thing that Minsc must decide for himself. Alone.

21.speaker: Minsc
21.text: Which is why I am asking you.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Everyone has the potential for good. It's just buried deeper in some, or lost along the way.

224.speaker: Minsc
224.text: I see. I ask only because... this throwing of our lot in with the Zhentarim. I can see the good in it, if I stop and squint for a moment.

88.speaker: Minsc
88.text: Evil might be turned to virtuous ends. Like hoisting a goblin by the toes so that you might use him to club another, larger goblin.

130.speaker: Minsc
130.text: But a word of warning, if Minsc may: no matter how mighty the warrior, you cannot swing a goblin forever.

369.speaker: Minsc
369.text: Sooner or later, it comes time to set the dizzy little demon down and do battle with him all the same. Do you understand my meaning?

143.speaker: Minsc
143.text: Minsc's metaphor could not have been clearer.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Don't worry - our alliance with the Zhentarim is temporary.

293.speaker: Minsc
293.text: Then Minsc is satisfied to swing the goblin a little bit longer.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: If you have a problem following my judgement, now is the time to say it.

323.speaker: Minsc
323.text: If you say Minsc must swing the goblin a little longer, then that is what he shall do.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Explain it to me again. Slowly.

23.speaker: Minsc
23.text: Bah. Let me find a chance to demonstrate instead. It need not be a goblin - an unmannerly halfling will do. The point is this:

226.speaker: Minsc
226.text: You say the path between good and evil is not always clear. Very well, says Minsc - Boo has always guided my boots, and so now he shall guide yours, too.

331.speaker: Minsc
331.text: My hamster's hopes are a heavy burden to bear. We must not let him down.

27.speaker: Minsc
27.text: I see. In the case of Nine-Fingers, perhaps it was all bunched up in that finger she lost. It shall be for Minsc and Boo to be her virtuous pinky.

249.speaker: Minsc
249.text: It is strange. A worm sits within my skull, twisting my thoughts; but it is you that have made Minsc see the world anew. You, my friend, are the true parasite!

96.speaker: Minsc
96.text: There is good and evil in all! Let us go crack villainous skulls, so that the virtue might leak free!

278.speaker: Minsc
278.text: Yes, Boo - I am becoming something of a philosophiser.

235.speaker: Minsc
235.text: Of course. Of course! One look into his beady little eyes should be enough to tell Minsc there is pure and untainted goodness in this world.

234.speaker: Minsc
234.text: Thank you, my friend. As ever, I shall do only what my heart and hamster tell me to:

209.speaker: Minsc
209.text: Kill the villains. Kill them all. Break them beneath my boots, no matter how they squeal for mercy.

8.speaker: Minsc
8.text: I feel better. Minsc is ready to go and do some butt-kicking.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: A fascinating discussion! I'll prepare some readings and we can pick it up at camp.

34.speaker: Minsc
34.text: Eh... do you know, I think the feeling has passed. I am well. And it was just gas. And I have forgotten the question.

125.speaker: Minsc
125.text: Yes, Boo, we really SHOULD be on our way!
125.context: NodeContext: Boo squeaks before Minsc's line - Minsc eagerly wants to change the topic

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Don't ask me. I'm just trying not to die.

110.speaker: Minsc
110.text: Ah - and by this you mean, so it is for all living creatures? A deep wisdom indeed.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'm just trying not to die. So please stop dipping your hamster in our food.

285.speaker: Minsc
285.text: No, my friend. If good and evil are a thing of the choosing, then it is for Boo alone to judge the virtues of his breakfast bath.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: You can't blame yourself. The cult were manipulating you.

78.speaker: Minsc
78.text: Minsc does not blame Minsc. Minsc blames the Stone Lord. But if the Stone Lord is Minsc, then, well... Minsc grows dizzy.

274.speaker: Minsc
274.text: Not now - I need a moment.

286.speaker: Minsc
286.text: Ah, I spoke too soon of starting the day. I have told him he is pretty enough, but Boo insists on returning to the beauty sleep.
286.context: NodeContext: Yawning, going back to bed after a midnight attack and making the excuse that it's Boo that wants to

316.speaker: Minsc
316.text: Quite the deed done, eh, my friend?

348.speaker: Minsc
348.text: Fine lodgings you have found, my friend! Boo is already in negotiations with the guardian spirits of this place.
348.context: NodeContext: Minsc's first greeting on seeing our camp.

102.speaker: Minsc
102.text: In Baldur's Gate, they are likely to be rat-formed, and eager to charge rent. But Boo shall secure safe slumber for all!

162.speaker: Minsc
162.text: Now - what do you need of Minsc?
